differences: Completely different subject matter: Transcription A is a quarterly sales revenue chart, Transcription B is a user authentication flow diagram
Different structural elements: A describes bars/curve and axes, B describes actor boxes, arrows, and a database node
Different hierarchy/flow: A is an XY chart with time on x-axis and revenue on y-axis; B is a left-to-right message sequence/timeline between actors
Labels and annotations differ: A uses Q1–Q4 and revenue values, B uses numbered steps 1–5, USER/SERVER/DB labels
Mode mismatch: A mode = Shading (chart), B mode = Structural (sequence diagram)
Colors documented do not match: A lists purple/white/black for chart elements, B lists blue/green/orange/gray for actors/arrows
Different reconstruction hints: A says 'curve shows growth then decline' and 'peak Q2–Q3'; B gives 'server box larger, database shown as cylinder' and step sequence
Dimensions differ significantly (35x15 vs 60x25) and imply different spatial complexity
Visual details missed differ: A notes missing exact values/grid lines; B notes missing colors/icons/rounded corners
Relationships and directional flow differ: A shows numeric magnitude over quarters, B shows message exchange and session establishment
Completeness mismatch: Each includes elements the other omits entirely (e.g., axes and numerical peaks vs session token generation and cookie storage)
